timeline.message: [ML] adjusts feature importance format and adds multi-class importance support

timeline.bodyText:
I am not 100% convinced this should be abs.
We don't write the feature importance value on the native side by looking at the norm of the vector.
Do we want to make this the norm too? Or do we thing abs is good enough?
@tveasey @valeriy42
timeline.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Can you please provide more context. What are you calculating here?
replies.author: valeriy42

replies.bodyText: @valeriy42 @tveasey this is calculating the "overall importance" of all the classes combined for a given feature. This is so we can measure "most important feature" independent of the classes.
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: norm would make it an L2 norm, abs makes it an L1 norm. Either way is suitable. I think, abs is better, since norm over-treats larger importances and ignores smaller once.
replies.author: valeriy42

timeline.bodyText: Is the abs necessary when the score is a norm? If the score can be -ve why is it wrong to use the -ve value?
timeline.author: davidkyle

replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.bodyText:
// If the classificationLabels exist, the X better
Missing word?
timeline.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText: Def, this comment makes no sense :D
replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure why this has to be a linked hash map? I'm assuming to preserve insertion order but why? If this was ever serialisable to xcontent the ordering could not be guaranteed
timeline.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText: ToXContent does not factor here. We are concerned about the order when the values are written to the ingest document.
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: FWIW, this sort of thing is already done with Object maps. Just cannot do it with specific stream inputs.
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Thinking about it more and looking more into the ingest doc code. I agree with you. This seems superfluous for now. If ordering becomes a concern for usability, we can add it in the future. The reading from the wire for both LinkedHashMap and HashMap would be exactly the same, so BWC is not a concern.
replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.message: removing the read in linked hashmap
